page.title: 06LOCAL CUSTOMS
page.content: During the last week of October the {Belper Fair}arrives.A fair has been held on the{Coppice}as a long established custom. Belper is the fair's last stand before its families winter here. The{Belper Carnival}is held on the first Saturday in July (this date was also the{Wakes Week}Saturday).Marching bands, cleverly decorated floats representing local firms, young peoples organisations and schools parade through town to the{High School In early May,Milford holds its May Day Procession.Children dance around the Maypole through the village commencing at the{New Inn}and finishing in the school playground.The costumes are made in school by the children with the help of their parents.
